document.docAuthor: Dantas, Galileu P. S., Hamada, Neusa & Mendes, Humberto F.
document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the knowledge of Stenochironomus Kieffer (Diptera, Chironomidae) from Brazil: seven new species and description of females and immatures of some previously known species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contribution to the knowledge of Stenochironomus Kieffer (Diptera, Chironomidae) from Brazil: seven new species and description of females and immatures of some previously known species

heading.emphasis:
Key to males of Neotropical
Stenochironomus Kieffer

subSubSection.paragraph:
(modified from
Borkent, 1984
,
S. licinus Borkent
was not included)

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Thorax, wing, legs, and abdominal tergites without dark markings or, at most, wing membrane uniformly light brown and apex of fore femur and all of fore tibia and tarsus darkened........................................................ 2
1 ’. Thorax, wings, legs or abdominal tergites (or several of these) with distinct darker markings......................... 8
2 . Anal point broad at base and with dorsal crest extending laterally along length..................................... 3
2 ’. Anal point narrow at base, either with expanded apex or narrow posteriorly but not with dorsal crest................... 4

3 . Thorax anteriorly elongated; setal patch of T IX on posteriorly projecting lobe......................
S . prolatus Borkent

3 ’. Thorax not anteriorly elongated; setal patch of T IX arranged on flattened area........................
S . vatius Borkent

4 . Anal point strongly spatulated...........................................
S . atlanticus Pinho, Mendes et Marcondes

5 . T IX with strong setae on a posterolateral flap................................
S . sebastiao Andersen, Mendes et Pinho
6 . Apex of T IX wedge-shaped in dorsal view; apical seta on appendage 2 elongated, about as long as subapical seta....... 7

6 ’. Apex of T IX truncated in dorsal view; apical seta on appendage 2 stout, shorter than subapical seta........
S . reissi Borkent

7 . Phallapodeme curved anterioly.......................................................
S . palliaculeatus Borkent

7 ’. Phallapodeme not curved anterioly..........................................
S . maikeae Andersen, Mendes et Pinho

9 . TIX with wedge-shaped apex, with short lateral lobes...................
S. messias Reis, Serpa-Filho et Ferreira-Keppler

9 . TIX with square-shaped apex, with large protruding lateral lobes..........
S. oliveirai Reis, Serpa-Filho et Ferreira-Keppler

10 . Fore femur with three discrete areas of pigmentation; only lateral and posterior margins of T II–IV pigmented..............................................................................................
S . triannulatus Borkent
10 ’. Fore femur with, at most, two areas of pigmentation; abdomen variably pigmented but not as above................... 11
11 . Anal point broad at base and with dorsal crest extending laterally along length.................................... 12
11 ’. Anal point narrow at base, either with or without expanded apex but not with dorsal crest........................... 21
12 . Lateral vitta completely pigmented; halter dark brown; eye not metallic.......................................... 13
12 ’. Lateral vitta, at most, only partially pigmented; halter pale; eye not metallic or shiny metallic........................ 14

13 . Entire scutum dark brown; AR> 100 .....................................................
S . crusanticus Borkent

13 ’. Only portion of scutum dark brown; AR< 100 ................................................
S . innocus Williams
14 . Superior volsella extending beyond apex of gonocoxite..................................................... 15
14 ’. Superior volsella, at most, to level of apex of gonocoxite.................................................... 17

16 . Anal point relatively broad; superior volsella with 10–14 setae.................................
S . pectinatus Borkent

16 ’. Anal point relatively slender; superior volsella with 4–9 setae....................................
S . gladius Borkent
17 . Mid and hind legs with pigmentation; thorax with pigmentation................................................ 18

17 ’. Mid and hind legs pale; thorax without pigmentation........................................
S . albidorsalis Borkent

18 . Superior volsella with pointed apex......................................................
S . manauara
sp. nov.

19 . Lateral vitta and postnotum without pigmentation..............................................
S. gracilis
sp. nov.

20 . Gonostylus swollen subapically, apex tapering................................................
S . fittkaui Borkent

20 ’. Gonostylus slender with uniform width along its length (
Fig. 7
)....................................
S . bare
sp. nov.
21 . Lateral vitta connected medially with dark pigmentation..................................................... 22
21 ’. Lateral vitta with or without pigmentation but not connected medially with darker pigmentation...................... 23

22 . Lateral vitta with two areas of dark pigmentation; nearly entire postnotum pigmented; posterior portion of abdominal T IV pig- mented.........................................................................
S . semifumosus (Edwards)

22 ’. Lateral vitta with only anterior portion pigmented; dorsal portion of postnotum pigmented; abdominal T IV pale...............................................................................................
S . zonarius Borkent
23 . Lateral vitta with two dark patches, one situated anteriorly to the other......................................... 24
23 ’. Lateral vitta with one dark patch or pigmentation absent...................................................... 25

24 . Fore femur and tibia with dorsal and ventral rows of setae more elongated than those of mid and hind legs; apex of anal point expanded in dorsal view; AR = 2.03–2.15 ....................................................
S . jubatus Borkent

24 ’. Fore femur and tibia with setae of similar length to those of mid and hind legs; apex of anal point slightly bulbosus in dorsal view; AR = 1.15–1.80 ..............................................................
S . quadrinotatus Borkent

25 . Nearly entire thorax completely brown; abdomen pale...........................................
S . varius Borkent
25 ’. Thorax mostly pale, with or without pattern of markings; abdomen pale or with pattern of marking.................. 26

26 . Lateral vitta with pigmentation along lateral margin which extends to anterior point of scutum........
S . leptopus (Kieffer)

26 ’. Lateral vitta with or without dark pigmentation; scutum with dark or light pigmentation, or without pigmentation, but never with pigmentation extending anterior of lateral vitta........................................................ 27

27. 2 / 3 anterior of scutum (
Fig. 1
B) and abdomen with dark pigmentation..........................
S . amazonicus
sp. nov.

27 ’. Anterior margin of scutum with or without pigmentation, but never dark pigmented; abdomen with or without pigmentation................................................................................................... 28
28 . Lateral vitta with one dark patch along anterior margin; mid and hind legs pale.................................... 29

28 ’. Lateral vitta with pigmentation restricted to stripe along lateral margin or lacking dark pigmentation; mid and hide legs with or without pigmentation................................................................................. 32

29 . Anal point expanded at apex................................................
S . roquei Dantas, Hamada
at Mendes

30 . Gonostylus stout (fig. 25 ); thirteenth flagellomere> 1.5 mm .....................................
S . suzanae
sp. nov.

31 . Abdomen with dark pigmentation; posterior setae of setal patch on T IX on posteriorly projecting lobe.....................................................................................................
S . impendens Borkent

31 ’. Abdomen lacking dark pigmentation; setal patch on T lX arranged on flattened area................
S . aculeatus Borkent

32 . Lateral vitta with dark stripe along lateral margin; T IX markedly broad.............................
S . discus Borkent
32 ’. Lateral vitta with pigmentation not as above or lacking dark pigmentation; T IX not broad.......................... 33

33 . Lateral vitta with a dark brown patch somewhat elliptic on posterior margin (
Fig. 8
B)..........
S . figueiredoensis
sp. nov.
33 ’. Lateral vitta with a dark pigmentation not as above or lacking dark pigmentation.................................. 34

34 . Lateral vitta with dark pigmentation (
Fig. 15
B).................................................
S . liviae
sp. nov.
